description: {"blocks":[{"key":"dkk2j","text":"This protocol was used to analysis glucosylceramide and glucosylsphingosine levels in mouse brain and liver.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"53att","text":"It was also described in previous publication (Mol Cell Neurosci. 2020 Jan:102:103451, doi: 10.1016)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

status.info: We use this protocol and it's working

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"fk91j","text":"The mouse brain and liver tissues (100 - 300 mg) were homogenized in 2% CHAPS solution (4 mL/g wet tissue) in 2 mL Omni homogenization tubes containing 8 mm ceramic beads ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"d3qeu","text":"The homogenates were processed on the Bead Ruptor 24 (Omni International, Kennesaw, GA) for two 30 second cycles at 5.65 m/s with a 45 second pause time. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1lav2","text":"The glucosylsphingosine and glucosylceramide in homogenate (50 μL) were extracted and analyzed","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6cjcu","text":"The brain internal standards including d5-GluCer(18:0) (250 ng/mL) for GluCer and d5-GluSph\n(200 ng/mL) for GluSph were prepared in acetonitrile solution.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"46v4q","text":" The samples were vortexed for approximately 3 min and then centrifuged at 10,000 rpm for 10 min. The supernatants were transferred to 1.2 mL glass inserts (VWR, West Chester, PA) in 96 well plates.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9fplh","text":"A quality control (QC) sample was prepared by pooling 20% of extracts from study samples and used to monitor the instrument performance.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6ds2","text":"The crude extracts were directly injected to LC–MS/MS system for analysis of GluSph and GluCer. CSF and GluSph in brain homogenates and the injection volumes were 100 μL and 5 μL, respectively.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"ekkm1","text":"LC–MS/MS analysis was conducted on a Shimadzu (Columbia, MD) Prominence HPLC system coupled with an Applied Biosystems/MDS Sciex (Ontario, Canada) 4000QTRAP mass spectrometer using multiple reaction monitoring (MRM)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4t7ru","text":"The HPLC system consists of Prominence HPLC system with a CBM-20A system controller, 2 LC-20 CE pumps, a SIL-20ACHT autosampler, and a DGU-20A5R degasser. The compartment of the autosampler was set at 4 °C.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3l15u","text":"For analysis of GluSph, the chromatography was performed at ambient temperature using Ascentis‱ Express HILIC (4.6 × 50 mm, 2.7 μm, Supelco, Bellefonte, PA) protected with a HILIC Securityguard‱ column (4 × 3.0 mm, Phenomenex, Torrance, CA)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":94,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":193,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"emoji","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"2F22346A9EBA11EE931C0A58A9FEAC02","name":":registered:"}},"1":{"type":"emoji","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"2F22346A9EBA11EE931C0A58A9FEAC02","name":":tm:"}}}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"b9c5i","text":"The compartment of the autosampler was set at 4 oC.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"882kk","text":"Mobile phase A (0.1% formic acid and 1 mM ammonium formate in water) and mobile phase B (0.1% formic acid and 1 mM ammonium formate in acetonitrile-water (95:5)) were operated with a gradient elution as follows: 0–0.2 min 100–95% B, 0.2–3.5 min 95% B, 3.5–3.9 min 95–90% B, 3.9–5.8 min 90% B, 5.8–5.9 min 90–10% B, 5.9–6.9 min 10% B, 6.9–7.0 min 10–100% B, and 7.0–8.8 min 100% B at a flow rate of 1.5 mL/min.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"54ods","text":"The HPLC flow was diverted to waste except for 2.0–6.5 min to mass spectrometer.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"28epa","text":"The ESI source temperature was 600 °C; the ESI needle was 5000 V; the declustering potentials for\nGluSph and d5-GluSph were 76, 76, 76, 76, and 80 V, respectively; both the entrance potential and the collision cell exit potential were 10 V for all compounds. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"d1j","text":"The collision and curtain gas were set at medium and 20, respectively.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4m0fm","text":"Both desolvation gas and nebulizing gas were set at 45. For MRM, the collision energies\nfor mass transitions of m/z 462.3 to 282.3 for GluSph and that for d5-GluSph were 31, 26, 38, and 31 V, respectively.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"ahs8e","text":"The dwell time was set at 50 ms for each mass transition","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4paer","text":"For analysis of GluCer,  the chromatography was performed at ambient temperature using Supelcosil‱ LC-Si (2.1 × 250 mm, 5 μm, Supelco, Bellefonte, PA) protected with a HILIC Securityguard‱ column (4 × 3.0 mm, Phenomenex, Torrance, CA).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":97,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":187,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"emoji","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"FF7B36E99EBA11EE931C0A58A9FEAC02","name":":tm:"}},"1":{"type":"emoji","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"FF7B36E99EBA11EE931C0A58A9FEAC02","name":":tm:"}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5pce","text":"Mobile phase A (5 mM ammonium acetate in water) and mobile phase B (5 mM ammonium acetate in acetonitrilemethanol-acetic acid (97:2:1)) were operated with a gradient elution as follows: 0–4.0 min 100% B, 4.0–4.1 min 100–95% B, 4.1–6.5 min 95% B, 6.5–6.6 min 95–10% B, 6.6–7.6 min 10% B, 7.6–7.7 min 10–100% B, 6.9–7.0 min 10–100% B, and 7.0–10 min 100% B at a flow rate of 1.5 mL/min. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"fmv9b","text":"The HPLC flow was diverted to waste except for 2.0–6.5 min to mass spectrometer","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"fnukp","text":"The ESI source temperature was 550 °C; the ESI needle was 5000 V; the declustering potentials for\nGluCer, GalCer, and DihexCer were 75, 75, and 80 V, respectively; both the entrance potential and the collision cell exit potential was 10 V for all the compounds.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7a3nv","text":"The collision and curtain gas were set at medium and 20, respectively.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5pq91","text":"The desolvation gas and nebulizing gas were set at 35 and 55, respectively.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"37ivg","text":"For MRM, the collision energies for mass transitions of m/z 700.5 to 264.3 for GalCer(16:0) and GluCer(16:0), m/z 728.5 to 264.3 for GalCer(18:0) and GluCer(18:0), m/z 756.5 to 264.3
for GalCer(20:0) and GluCer(20:0), m/z 784.6 to 264.3 for GalCer(22:0)
and GluCer(22:0), m/z 812.7 to 264.3 for GalCer(24:0) and GluCer
(24:0), m/z 810.7 to 264.3 for GalCer(24:1) and GluCer(24:1), m/z
862.7 to 264.3 for DihexCer(16:0), m/z 890.7 to 264.3 for DihexCer
(18:0), m/z 918.7 to 264.3 for DihexCer(20:0), m/z 946.7 to 264.3 for
DihexCer(22:0), m/z 974.8 to 264.3 for DihexCer(24:0), m/z 972.7 to
264.3 for DihexCer(24:1), m/z 733.5 to 269.3 for d5-GluCer(18:0), and
m/z 865.7 to 264.3 for d3- LacCer(16:0) were 50, 50, 50, 50, 50, 50, 61,
67, 67, 67, 67, 50 and 61 V, respectively. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"7goll","text":"The dwell time was set at 50 ms for each mass transition.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"89dmd","text":"Data processing was conducted with Analyst 1.5.1 (Applied Biosystems).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"fpvh9","text":"The signal of noise ratio of analyte \u003c 3 was defined as below limit of detection (LOD).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"dnuu8","text":"The relative quantification data were obtained as peak area ratios of analytes to their internal standards, which were converted to concentrations.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

title: Glucosylceramide and glucosylsphingosine analysis
